title: Ackerman NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: Fresh and crisp with sliced apple fruits, this is a light lively wine. It is dry although there is a touch of sweetness from the ripe pear flavor. Ready to drink, it is fruity and refreshing.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Bridão Reserva Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)
description: Fresh, fruity and crisp, this is an attractive, refreshing wood aged wine. It has citrus and crisp apple and riper apricot flavors, bright with acidity and needing a few more months to age. Drink from late 2016.

title: Avancia 2014 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: This light-colored Godello smells mostly of oak and lees. The palate is dilute in feel, with yeasty flavors of banana and vanilla along with pithy bitterness and resiny oak. An overt candied sweetness takes over on the finish.

title: Colterenzio 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Chamomile flower and yellow stone fruit aromas are the primary aromas. The simple, straightforward palate tastes of yellow apple skin, a hint of white peach and a touch of mineral alongside crisp acidity.

title: Black Star Farms 2013 Arcturos Pinot Blanc (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Pale lemon in color, with a slightly green tinge, this is a light, crisp and steely Pinot Blanc. Citrus zest and quince carry the nose and palate, making this a perfectly enjoyable everyday white.

title: Bodega Norton 2014 Barrel Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Herbal, tomatoey red-berry aromas lead to a fleshy, fresh palate with barely any structure. Plum, currant and herbal flavors finish solid, with basic flavors of oak and spice.

title: Buena Vista 2013 Bela's Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A weight of oak and tannin marks this full-blown, bombastic expression of the variety. It has a reduced quality to the fruit and an unexpected twist of mint.

title: Campos de Sueños 2014 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Yeasty apple aromas lead to a fair and balanced palate. Mixed citrus flavors come with a tropical leaning, while the finish is clean, mild and fades fast. Drink right away.

title: Ca'Ronesca 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Apple, citrus and yellow floral aromas are what hits the nose first. Them they carry over to the simple, zesty palate along with green pear and a note of bitter nut. Bracing acidity generates a clean finish.

title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)
description: The wine is all fruit, so fresh and crisp and light. Sliced apples and sharp lime juice are swirled around with so much acidity that the wine just dances in the glass. This is delicious and ready to drink.

title: Casata Monfort 2014 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: This fun, copper-colored wine offers aromas of cut grass and Bartlett pear. The simple palate shows white peach and green apple alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.

title: Castel Sallegg 2014 Leisen Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Subdued aromas of yellow stone fruit and a whiff of cut grass lead the nose. The linear, rather slender palate shows grapefruit, tomato leaf and lime alongside brisk acidity.

title: Stickybeak 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Austere and slightly bittersweet at the start, this wine evolves into flavors of lemon and lime around large wrappings of oak that give it a woody taste. The finish is lean and brief.

title: Table No. 7 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Full bodied, quite flavorful and generous in texture, this wine will be a crowd pleaser. It smells like toast, vanilla and maple, tastes juicy and plummy, and has a lingering, almost sweet finish.

title: Nathaniel Rose 2013 Katherine & Martha's Vineyard Hill Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Having seen 20 months in French oak, the aromas of this wine are dominated by cola and rooibos tones. The light- to medium-bodied palate shows more fruit tones, with juicy red cherry and black currant taking on an almost candied flavor. Sandy tannins and a line of acidity give enough support to keep this Pinot in check.
designation: Katherine & Martha's Vineyard Hill Road Vineyard

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Cassa Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This is a ripe wine with its juicy black fruits and generous tannins. It has a mature character that's emphasized by the wood aging and rich fruitiness. There's a touch of pepper at the end from the alcohol which is a shame. Drink now.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Marquês de Borba Tinto Red (Alentejo)
description: A popular Portuguese brand, this is a ripe, fruity wine that's made to be drunk young. It has fresh berry fruits and some firm tannins to support the otherwise easygoing acidity and fruitiness. Aging in large barrels has given the wine an open, ripe aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.

title: Jigar 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Earthy and soft, this structured, medium-bodied wine is elusive in fruit, playing its hand with shy suggestions of cranberry and raspberry underneath integrated tannins and subtle oak.

title: MAN Family Wines 2014 Bosstok Pinotage (Coastal Region)
description: Medium-intense aromas of brambly berry, cherry and plum are coupled with seductive notes of milk chocolate and licorice root. The palate is clean and direct, with straightforward black-fruit flavors that are framed by moderate tannins and juicy acidity, finishing fresh and fruity. Drink now.

title: Franz Haas 2014 Lepus Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Alluring scents of apple and Alpine wildflower float over to the bright but slender palate along with notes of pear and mineral. Brisk acidity gives it a clean, crisp finish.

title: M2 2013 Lodi Native Soucie Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)
description: This has an aroma like charred wood, and meaty, smoky, steak-sauce flavors. It's not a style for everyone, but it does have a full body, bold flavors and the unique packaging and hands-off winemaking style of the Lodi Native wines.

title: Griffin Creek 2012 Merlot (Rogue Valley)
description: Tart, acidic hard-candy fruit flavors come through, along with hints of sweet spices. But the wine quickly hits a wall, stopping abruptly in a short, tight finish with austere tannins.

title: Hawthorne 2014 Barrel Reserve Auxerrois (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Fresh peach and pear mark the nose and palate. The intensity is bright yet fleeting on the midpalate. Overall this is quite enjoyable, with balanced acidity, making it a quite enjoyable every-day white.

title: HPSepicurean 2013 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Specs of dusty mineral lend some depth to this honeyed, off-dry Riesling. The palate is straightforward but brisk, marked by pressed apple, pear and a tart lemon-lime finish. Drink now.

title: Dorigo 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This opens with muted aromas of yellow stone fruit and tomato vine while the rather lean palate offers unripe peach, citrus and mineral alongside brisk acidity.

title: Duran 2010 Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Dusty apple aromas form the opening on this scratchy Brut Nature. Flavors of pickle brine and weedy citrus fruits end similarly. This isn't overtly faulty, but it's briny and funky.

title: Restivo 2015 Silver Series Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Lightly perfumed tropical-fruit aromas are dusty and a touch soapy. This feels round, oily and cidery, while flavors of orange, nectarine and apricot finish with good weight, texture and length.

title: RR 2013 Erik's Refreshing Riesling (Nahe)
description: Forward, fruity swathes of peach and apple verge on overrripe in this off-dry, slightly fleshy Riesling. Vibrant lemon acidity balances the palate out neatly on the finish. Drink now.

title: Fantinel 2014 Tenuta Sant'Elena Friulano (Collio)
description: Aromas of toasted almond and yellow apple skin lead the nose. The aromas follow through to the palate along with a hint of peach and a mineral note. It's rather lean, with brisk acidity.

title: Mirassou 2014 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Plummy aromas, peachy flavors and a bright mouthfeel lend a lot of appeal to this medium-bodied wine. It tastes smooth and rounded in texture, ripe and somewhat rich but not overdone.
